visual.name: Drill_Down_Timeline_PIN_By_ZoomCharts
visual.displayName: Drill Down Timeline PRO (Pin) by ZoomCharts

dataRoles.description:
Date Hierarchy supports date hierarchies or separate time unit columns. Column names must correspond to the desired time units for the X-Axis.
Supported name formats are:
- single units: ms, millisecond, milliseconds, sec, second, seconds, min, minute, minutes, hour, hours, day, days, dayofmonth, mon, month, months, quarter, quarters, year, years, decade 
- x <unit> for multiple units (e.g. 5 s, 15 minutes, etc.) where x is a whole number and <unit> is one of the following: s, seconds, m, minutes, h hours, w, week, y, years.
dataRoles.name: Category

trialLicense.description: Currently, this block is meant to be hidden.

info.description: Turn off to hide the info button. The info button can only be removed if a paid license is detected.

preview.description: Hidden field, only enabling it from a theme to allow some functionallity.

hideProperties.description: Hidden field, provide values delimited with ',' from a theme to hide properties.

arrowSize.description: Defines the height and width of the element.

arrowHoverBackgroundColorOpacity.displayName: Arrow Background Color Opacity on Hover

fontSize.description: Font Size can be in px or pt, depending on the setting selected in Advanced Settings -> Font Size Unit.

displayPeriods.description: Sets initial display period to the chosen value

initialDisplayPeriod.description: Select the default initial display period. Visual will emit a filter upon a load unless other time filter already exists

displayUnits.description: Select which display unit is displayed when the visual loads.

initialDisplayUnitMode.description:
Select whether the initial display initial unit is selected automatically or select a particular one:
'Top' (default) - the top (largest) unit is selected
'Bottom' - the bottom (smallest) unit is selected
'Custom' - select a particular unit. If more than one toggle is enabled, one of the enabled units will be selected.

lastSavedUnit.description: If enabled, the visual will remember what time range and display unit was active when the report was last saved. If 'Reset Button' is enabled in the Toolbar menu, you will see it light up as soon as you navigate away from the configured initial display unit. You can clear the saved unit by saving the report after the visual has been reset to the configured initial display unit with the 'Reset' button.

fontSize.description: Font Size can be in px or pt, depending on the setting selected in Advanced Settings -> Font Size Unit.

titleFontSize.description: Font Size can be in px or pt, depending on the setting selected in Advanced Settings -> Font Size Unit.

forceTopAndBottomValues.description: Forces values at the top and bottom of the axis

valueType.description: Select value type for the axis. 'Numeric' and 'Percentage' will interpret any numeric value. 'Timestamp' requires series data to be Unix timestamp (seconds since January 1, 1970), and values will be formatted according to the selected Timestamp Format.

valueDecimal.description: Set number of decimals for values

percentageDecimal.description: Set number of decimals for percentages

showValueAffixes.description: Whether to use affixes or not (e.g. currency)

lineWidth.description: This setting allows to adjust the width and spacing for dashes in the gridline

scaleMinStep.description: Smallest difference between two labels. For example, use 1 to disallow the labels to go into fractions.

customRange.description: Set to true to define custom value range for the value axis

scaleAdjustmentTolerance.description: How much empty space to leave above the maximum value. 0 means no empty space 1 means 50% empty space

fontSize.description: Font Size can be in px or pt, depending on the setting selected in Advanced Settings -> Font Size Unit.

titleFontSize.description: Font Size can be in px or pt, depending on the setting selected in Advanced Settings -> Font Size Unit.

alignZeroToPrimary.description: Whether to align the zero with the primary axis

fontSize.description: Font Size can be in px or pt, depending on the setting selected in Advanced Settings -> Font Size Unit.

maxUnitWidth.description: Maximum width of a single time axis display unit (in pixels). Min value: 0, Max value: 2500.

minUnitWidth.description: Minimum width of a single time axis display unit (in pixels). Min value: 0, Max value: 2500.

lineWidth.description: This setting allows to adjust the width and spacing for dashes in the gridline

dynamicAllData.description: If enabled, the visual auto-adjusts the display period when the available data changes. This setting does not apply if ‘Custom’ display period is selected in the visual. Display units might change to accommodate the auto-adjusting display period.

currentTime.description: Show an indicator for the current time

thresholdLineValue1.description: Numerical value, which can be either whole number or decimal number. Decimal number is "." separated. Examples: 5 or 5.0 or 5.5

thresholdAreaFrom1.description: Numerical value, which can be either whole number or decimal number. Decimal number is "." separated. Examples: 5 or 5.0 or 5.5

thresholdAreaTo1.description: Numerical value, which can be either whole number or decimal number. Decimal number is "." separated. Examples: 5 or 5.0 or 5.5

thresholdValueAxis1.description: The value axis linked to the series.

showThresholdLabel1.description: Whether to display a threshold label

thresholdLabelxPadding1.description: How many pixels the label should be offset from the edge

thresholdLabelyPadding1.description: How many pixels the label should be offset from the threshold

thresholdLabelDecimals1.description: Set number of decimals for values

separateNegativeValues.description: Whether to display data with negative values separately

drawFullArea.description: Whether to fill the area under each series from the axis line or only from the previous series

leftPadding.description:
Left padding for column in px
Max value: 15px

rightPadding.description:
Right padding for column in px
Max value: 15px

clusterLeftPadding.description:
Left padding for column clusters in px
Max value: 15px

clusterRightPadding.description:
Right padding for column clusters in px
Max value: 15px

locale.description: Locale to set (sets translations, day of week etc.)

location.description: Toolbar can be shown on the chart area our outside it

backBtn.description: Whether to show the `Back` button in the toolbar

zoomOutBtn.description: Whether to show the `Zoom-out` button in the toolbar

logScale.description: Whether to show the `Lin/Log` button in the toolbar

displayPeriod.description: Whether to show the `Display Period` button in the toolbar

displayUnit.description: Whether to show the `Display Unit` button in the toolbar

useStackedValue.description: Whether label should be the sum of stack values or the individual values

percentageDecimal.description: Set number of decimals for percentages

emptyPopupText.description: Text to display when there is no data.

opacity.description: Opacity of the gradient color, 0 - transparent, 100 - opaque. This setting controls the outermost opacity level of the column, if gradient mode is enabled. Opacity starts from 100 at the Gradient start location and decreases towards the set value in a linear way.

gradientStep.description: 0 - inside, 100 - outside. If the outer opacity of the column is provided, opacity calculation starts at this point from 100 to the specified opacity value.

baseColorSaturationAdjustment.description: 0 means 0% saturation, 100 means 100% saturation;  50 means saturation is unaffected. E.g. 51 means that additional 1% is added to the color's saturation.

baseColorLightnessAdjustment.description: 0 means 0% lightness, 100 means 100% lightness;  50 means lightness is unaffected. E.g. 51 means that additional 1% is added to the color's lightness.

valueLabelsEnabled.description: Enables value labels for all series that follow the default series configuration and displays the 'Series Value Labels Defaults' menu.

widthScale.description: What percent to scale column widths by.

valueAxis.description: The value axis linked to the series.

cornerRadius.description: Corner radius in pixels. A larger corner radius produces a more rounded corner. Accepted values - 0 (default) to 100.

showInLegend.description: Whether to show the series in the legend.

enabledByDefault.description: Enables or disables the series in the legend when the visual loads. Disabled legend items are hidden from the chart.

showInInfoPopup.description: Whether to show the series in the tooltip.

tooltipAggregation.description: Select aggregation type for tooltips when multiple items are selected. The default aggregation types are: 'Sum' for columns, and 'Average' for measures.

useStackedValue.description: Whether label should be the sum of the stack values or the individual value

allowLabelSkip.description: Skipping value labels should be allowed when there is not enough space to display all of them large enough or at all. When enabled, fewer but bigger labels should be displayed.

allowOverlap.description: Whether to draw this series's labels even if they vertically overlap with other labels

allowOverlappingLabelStacking.description: Enable for each series whose value labels should be displayed in a stack. Stacked labels might be moved from their original positions. Alternatively, you might choose to display overlapping labels or omitting overlapping labels.

allowOverlappingLabelStacking.description: Enable for each series whose value labels should be displayed in a stack. Stacked labels might be moved from their original positions. Alternatively, you might choose to display overlapping labels or omitting overlapping labels.

fontSize.description: Font Size can be in px or pt, depending on the setting selected in Advanced Settings -> Font Size Unit.

percentageDecimal.description: Set number of decimals for percentages

widthScale.description: What percent to scale column widths by.

valueAxis.description: The value axis linked to the series.

cornerRadius.description: Corner radius in pixels. A larger corner radius produces a more rounded corner. Accepted values - 0 (default) to 100.

showInLegend.description: Whether to show the series in the legend.

enabledByDefault.description: Enables or disables the series in the legend when the visual loads. Disabled legend items are hidden from the chart.

showInInfoPopup.description: Whether to show the series in the tooltip.

tooltipAggregation.description: Select aggregation type for tooltips when multiple items are selected. The default aggregation types are: 'Sum' for columns, and 'Average' for measures.

tooltipShadowSensitivity.description: Accepted values - 0 to 100. At 100 shadows are almost always on. At 0 shadows are almost never displayed.

useStackedValue.description: Whether label should be the sum of the stack values or the individual value
